solution_line_template: At a rate of {temp_rise_rate} degrees per hour, in {power_out_duration} hours the temperature rose by {power_out_duration}*{temp_rise_rate}=<<{power_out_duration}*{temp_rise_rate}={total_temp_rise}>>{total_temp_rise} degrees.
At a rate of {temp_lower_rate} degrees per hour, the air conditioner can reduce the temperature {total_temp_rise} degrees in {total_temp_rise}/{temp_lower_rate}={time_to_restore} hours.
